alert.note: Alert for Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:57PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Coos County through 530 PM EDT... At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Berlin, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Berlin, Gorham, Jefferson, Dummer, Milan, Randolph, Stark and Shelburne. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
